Pants are obviously used and had been washed more than once. The fabric smelled of laundry soap, fabric was super thin (no starch left in the fabric), the waist and cuffs were faded to light grey indicating lots of wear and washing. The tag in waist band was faded to the point it is unreadable.
Really good pants, this is more of a construction work/heavy duty pant disguised as a tactical pant, but it is awesome. Good prices too.

I work in construction and have owned all different types of carpenter/work pants throughout my career. These blow all of them out of the water, I just received my 3rd pair and am planning on buying more to make them my full arsenal Monday through Friday. There’s more storage/pockets than you need which is always a good thing, they are super flexible/comfortable and the BIGGEST sell on these is the elastic waistband. The other big name brands always have weird sizes and maybe the pants fit great, but the waist is too tight or too loose and when you bend down it causes pain. These pants are amazing and worth the price. See for yourself. I hope the industry follows suit in the future, no more outdated stuff work pants!

Been wearing these pants for hiking, working, camping, training drills….you name it. Have two pairs of these and both have not ripped or failed. Zippers are still good and the stitching has held up. I even burned it a bit but the embers didn’t seem to do much. The only downside is the top is a bit tight so getting your hands into the front pockets are a pain. The only thing I keep in the front pockets are my knife and some cash. The rest of my item are usually in my cargo pockets.  It’s been four years now and I’ve had no issues.

评论概述: Not stretchy or flexible in the least.
评论详情: These wear like 1990 jnco jeans. They have a short zipper so no room for all that man stuff. They don’t flex at all. They are like stiff stiff. The waist band is TIGHT. I’m a 34x34 and have been for 20 years. These fit like a 33x34. They are tight. I cut wood for a living and the flat front pockets fill with sawdust. Traditional side slit front pockets are way better at keeping out debris. I really was hoping for better product than this. I know for some this may be the ticket but not if you are around debris or wood working or chainsaws as the pockets fill up. And if you bend over (no stretch) the back wants to pull right off your butt. I’d return but I wore them and they are filthy after a days work.

类型: Size: 32W x 30LColor: Duratex Pants Police Navy
评论详情: Big

Really good fit and function for the carpentry work i do. Material has been durable. Easy to squat, kneel, sit or stand in. The expandable waste band is bad enough to keep me from wearing these pants. The elastic is very loose, so I have to wear a snug belt to keep the pants up.  The material gathering around the elastic is bulky and harsh on my skin. I only wear them if I tuck in a shirt to soften the irritation around my waste.

I am wearing them right now as I give my review. They are light and comfortable with a lot of pockets and belt loops. The size is exactly what they advertised and they have a little bit of elastic on the waist so they don’t squeeze me so I’m uncomfortable. I like them so much that I just ordered another pair in black. Way to go!

评论概述: I like them a lot, but...
评论详情: There's no room for the ass... there's no give in the fabric, which I understand is part of the rip stop technology, but I ordered my standard jeans size of 32/30, and they bind when I swing my leg up and into my truck, and they pull down when I get down on my hands and knees, which exposes my boxers. Not the most professional look. However, they're a great work pant. All the pockets are excellent. The color is tasteful (tan). And they are holding up well. Going to order a 34/30 to see if they just run small.

More comfortable than my 5.11 taclite pros, although I prefer the pocket layout on the 5.11s, but for less than half the price I won't complain too much, I've been treating them pretty harshly and they're holding up to everything so far. Also a 30rd mag (STANAG) fits well in the side pocket, watch pocket is very deep and could easily fit a knife larger than an ontario rat 1, it also has a separate little pocket next to the watch pocket, wide enough for a small knife (barely fits my kizer assassin, I think I have the xl version). I'd recommend em. They unfortunately don't shed water like the 5.11s though, but otherwise very comfortable and durable.

Finally some decent "whites". I really love these pants and have found them to be really comfortable.  I am a paint contractor that still believes in wearing whites, and they have been increasingly hard to find. Carhartt discontinued white altogether, Stan Ray is gone, Dickies are cheap crap, Duluth Trading also no white anymore...so here we are. As I'm writing this I am about to order a couple more pairs.
Good quality,  lots of pockets,  fit is slightly long , but very workable.  Very satisfied  .

评论概述: Stylish, but Not Work Pants.  Don't bend over- crushes chestnuts and exposes the back door.
评论详情: I wanted to like these... I mean I can see the attempt at Style meets Functionality. But for me these seem like the WORST of both worlds, not the best. - Take a cool fashion design (low waist) and try to use them for heavy outdoors work. Nope. - Take some good work appropriate material, extra pockets and add bad design and cut to be stylish. Nope. Even with the right size (38x30) for roomy on my average man size these are NOT comfortable to wear for mowing the grass, doing yardwork, moving boxes or warehouse work, etc. The pockets are just weird and uncomfortable. Not as practical as hoped for. The waist and crotch inseam is too short... it seems like a TIGHT FIT so every time I BEND over, YIKES crush the chestnuts and expose the back door! I mean for maybe somebody who wants to stand around and look cool... awesome, do that. For actually bending, squatting, working, etc. NOPE. Not these. I have some other CQR stuff that is okay. At this price point the value is terrible as WORK pants.
Nice material but the way it's made do not like it. It pulls on front upper legs when you walk and pulls inside the but when you bend uncomfortably made returning.

I’ve purchased a few of these tactical brand pants and they’re great. This is my first two pairs in white and in the utility tool version. I bought these because I am a painter and I was tired of the loose feel of normal painting pants, even though they’re cheaper. I went with these for the fit, the look, and comfort. They are a bit pricey, For wearing them to get paint on them, but I feel way more relaxed while wearing these when I work. If the price was a bit lower, I would definitely continue purchasing these always for my go to painting pants. For now, I wear them when I know I’m not gonna get to messy at work, Just to keep them as clean as possible.

I didn't know what to think at first.  I have lots of CQR clothing.  I am talk and thin and I like the way they fit.  They also wear exceptional well.  I have pants over 5 years old that I still wear (on the farm).  These are a straight leg sapper work pant, relaxed fit, woodland cammo.  These are going to be my favorites!  Many pockets, some divided for tools, flashlight,  pencils and such.  A to small phone pocket.  I wish it was large enough for a 3x5 writing pad. And a hatchet loop.  The right hand pocket has a leather like reinforced corner.  I assume that's for a tape rule, however I have clips on my power tools so I can hang them on my pockets while climbing ladders.These are nice.  The material is light but will not fail.  They keep their appearance well, and being camo, should hide small stains.  Yes my new favorite.I just wrote a review on another style of CQR pant that is not masculine in the slightest. I mention this as their reviews get bunched together.  This review is on the sapper tactical work pant.
Good fit

These pants fit well and are true to size. The material is very thin and light weight, they also burn through easily from grinding sparks and welding/slag, don't recommend these pants for more than yard work, maybe good for hot weather hiking.
The pants fit exactly to what the chart states. Good quality, comfortable cool fit, with an elastic waistband for freedom of movement.

They are comfortable but the 4 stars is because I thought they would be a little heavier-duty pants, they are a bit thin. Not bad for hot days though.

The comfort is terrible. But it got two stars because it is durable. Everything is great but I cannot wear them because it restricts every movement I do in them. I can't use the side pockets, because anything I have in them is pressed so hard against my thigh. I cannot even get the bottom of the pant leg past halfway up my shin. I'm returning mine and wish I hadn't bought them. However if you're into skinny jeans these are for you
